SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io.socket.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.io.socket.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, Runnable
public final class Server extends Object implements AutoCloseable, Runnable
A multi-threaded server for handling client connections and processing requests.

This class uses Java NIO for non-blocking socket operations, enabling scalability for multiple simultaneous connections. It processes requests and responses asynchronously with dedicated thread pools for reading and writing operations. Console commands allow for administrative control of the server.

Features:

  • Accepts and manages multiple client connections.
  • Processes requests using Router.
  • Handles administrative console commands for server control.
  • Graceful shutdown and resource cleanup.

Usage:

 Server server = new Server(configuration, consoleWorker);
 new Thread(server).start();

Thread Safety:

This class is thread-safe, with proper synchronization for shared resources.

Since:
1.0

    A container for client-specific data used during communication with the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(ServerConfiguration configuration, ConsoleWorker console)
      Constructs a new Server instance with the specified configuration and console worker.

      This constructor initializes the server with the necessary configuration settings and console for administrative commands. It also creates thread pools for handling read and write operations and initializes the server resources.

      The constructor ensures that neither the configuration nor the console worker is null. If either is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      configuration - the ServerConfiguration containing server settings, such as the port.
      console - the ConsoleWorker for handling administrative commands via the console.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if configuration or console is null.

  • Method Details

    • createThreadPool

      private ExecutorService createThreadPool(String name)
      Creates a thread pool for managing tasks with a specified name prefix for its threads.

      This method creates a ThreadPoolExecutor configured with:

      • A fixed number of threads equal to the number of available processors.
      • An ArrayBlockingQueue with a capacity defined by QUEUE_CAPACITY to store tasks awaiting execution.
      • Daemon threads with a custom name prefix to aid in debugging.

      The thread pool ensures that tasks are executed concurrently without blocking the main thread, making it suitable for handling I/O operations like reading and writing client data.

      Usage:

       ExecutorService pool = createThreadPool("ReadPool");
      Parameters:
      name - the prefix for the names of threads in the thread pool.
      Returns:
      a configured ExecutorService instance for executing tasks.

    • initServer

      private void initServer()
      Initializes the server by setting up the socket channel and selector.

      This method performs the necessary setup for the server to start accepting connections: it opens a ServerSocketChannel, binds it to the configured port, sets it to non-blocking mode, and registers it with a Selector to monitor SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT events.

      If any I/O error occurs during initialization, the server logs the error and throws an IllegalStateException to prevent further operations.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the server fails to initialize due to an I/O error.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the server's main loop, handling console commands and I/O events.

      This method runs the server's main loop, which alternates between processing console commands and handling selector keys for I/O events. The loop continues until the isRunning flag is set to false.

      Any unexpected exceptions are logged, and the server shuts down gracefully in the finally block.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • processConsoleCommands

      private void processConsoleCommands()
      Processes administrative commands entered via the console.

      This method checks if there is input available from the console and, if so, reads a command and passes it to the handleCommand(String) method for processing.

      Common commands include:

      • exit: Shuts down the server.
      • save: Saves the current state of data managed by CollectionManager.

      Any errors encountered during input reading are logged as warnings.

    • handleCommand

      private void handleCommand(String command) throws IOException
      Handles specific commands entered via the console.

      This method processes commands recognized by the server, such as shutting down the server or saving data. If an unknown command is entered, it logs a warning and writes an error message to the console.

      Supported commands:

      • exit: Stops the server by setting isRunning to false and waking up the Selector to exit the main loop.
      • save: Invokes the CollectionManager.save() method to persist data.
      • Other commands: Writes an "Unknown command" message to the console.
      Parameters:
      command - the command entered by the user via the console.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while handling the command.

    • processSelectorKeys

      private void processSelectorKeys() throws IOException
      Processes selector keys to handle I/O events for connected clients.

      This method retrieves the set of selected keys from the Selector and iterates over them. Each key represents an I/O event such as accepting a connection, reading data, or writing data. The method delegates the handling of these events to the appropriate handlers based on the key's state.

      Workflow:

      • Writes a progress indicator to the console.
      • Uses selector.select() to wait for I/O events with a timeout.
      • Iterates through the selected keys and processes each one:
        • If the key is acceptable, a new connection is accepted.
        • If the key is readable, data is read from the client.
        • If the key is writable, data is written to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during selector operations.

    • acceptConnection

      private void acceptConnection() throws IOException
      Accepts a new client connection and registers it with the selector.

      This method is invoked when a key with the SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT operation is detected. It accepts the client's connection, configures it for non-blocking mode, registers it with the selector for reading operations, and initializes its Server.ClientData.

      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while accepting or configuring the connection.

    • processRead

      private void processRead(SelectionKey key)
      Processes a readable key by delegating the read operation to a thread in the read pool.

      This method is invoked when a key with the SelectionKey.OP_READ operation is detected. It retrieves the associated SocketChannel and Server.ClientData, then submits a read task to the read thread pool.

      Workflow:

      • Retrieves the client's channel and Server.ClientData from the key.
      • Submits a task to the read pool to handle the read operation.
      • On successful read, processes the client's data.
      • Handles any I/O errors by logging and closing the connection.
      Parameters:
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the readable client channel.

    • readFromClient

      private boolean readFromClient(SocketChannel client, SelectionKey key, Server.ClientData clientData) throws IOException
      Reads data from the client channel into the read buffer.

      This method attempts to read data from the client's SocketChannel into the ByteBuffer stored in the client's Server.ClientData. If the end of the stream is reached, the connection is closed. Otherwise, it logs the number of bytes read.

      Workflow:

      • Retrieves the client's read buffer.
      • Reads data from the client channel into the buffer.
      • If the end of the stream is detected, closes the connection.
      • Logs the number of bytes read and returns true if data was successfully read.
      Parameters:
      client - the client's SocketChannel.
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the client channel.
      clientData - the Server.ClientData object containing the client's read buffer.
      Returns:
      true if data was read successfully; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while reading from the client channel.

    • processClientData

      private void processClientData(SocketChannel client, Server.ClientData clientData, SelectionKey key) throws IOException
      Processes data received from the client and handles complete requests.

      This method examines the client's read buffer for complete requests. If a complete request is found, it extracts the data, deserializes it into a Request, and delegates it for further processing. Incomplete requests are left in the buffer for future reads.

      Workflow:

      • The buffer is flipped to prepare it for reading.
      • The method iterates through the buffer, checking for complete requests.
      • When a complete request is detected, the corresponding data is extracted and processed.
      • The buffer is compacted at the end to preserve unread data.
      Parameters:
      client - the client's SocketChannel.
      clientData - the Server.ClientData object containing the client's buffer and write queue.
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the client channel.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the buffer.

    • handleClientRequest

      private void handleClientRequest(SocketChannel client, byte[] data, SelectionKey key)
      Handles a deserialized request from a client, processes it, and queues a response.

      This method is responsible for routing the deserialized Request using the Router, generating an appropriate Response, and queuing it for sending back to the client.

      Workflow:

      • The request data is deserialized into a Request object.
      • The request is routed through the Router to produce a response.
      • The response is added to the client's write queue for sending.
      • The client's selection key is updated to allow writing.

      Error handling ensures that any failure in deserialization or processing is logged without disrupting the server workflow.

      Parameters:
      client - the client's SocketChannel.
      data - the byte array containing the serialized Request object.
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the client channel.

    • getUser

      private User getUser(Request request) throws CredentialException
      Retrieves a User from the system based on the provided Request.

      This method performs several validation and authentication steps:

      • Checks if the Request contains valid user credentials.
      • If the user does not exist, automatically registers the user by saving their username and password.
      • Verifies that the provided password matches the stored password.

      If any validation or authentication step fails, a CredentialException is thrown with a descriptive message.

      Failure Scenarios:

      • If the userDto in the Request is null, the method throws a CredentialException with a message indicating the absence of authorization.
      • If the username or password in the userDto is blank, the method throws a CredentialException with a specific message.
      • If the user is not found after attempting to register, or if the password validation fails, a CredentialException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      request - the Request containing the user's credentials.
      Returns:
      the authenticated User.
      Throws:
      CredentialException - if any validation or authentication step fails.
      See Also:
      • User
      • Request
      • UserService

    • processWrite

      private void processWrite(SelectionKey key)
      Processes writable keys by sending queued responses to the client.

      This method is executed in the write thread pool and ensures that all queued responses for the client are sent. If all responses are successfully sent, the key's interest is updated to OP_READ to resume reading from the client.

      Workflow:

      • The method retrieves the client channel and associated Server.ClientData.
      • The Server.ClientData.getWriteQueue() is processed, sending responses to the client.
      • If the write operation is complete, the key's interest is updated to allow reading.

      Any exceptions encountered during writing are logged, and the connection is closed if necessary.

      Parameters:
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the client channel.

    • writeToClient

      private boolean writeToClient(SocketChannel client, Server.ClientData clientData) throws IOException
      Writes data from the client's write queue to the client channel.

      This method retrieves the ByteBuffer objects from the client's write queue and sends the data to the client. If the buffer cannot be completely written in one operation, it leaves the remaining data in the buffer and returns false to indicate a partial write.

      Workflow:

      • Iterates through the write queue of ByteBuffer objects.
      • Attempts to write each buffer's content to the client's socket channel.
      • If a buffer has remaining data, the method stops and waits for the next writable event.
      • When the queue is empty, the method returns true to signal completion.

      Partial writes ensure that large responses or slow clients do not block other server operations.

      Parameters:
      client - the SocketChannel representing the client connection.
      clientData - the Server.ClientData object containing the write queue and buffers.
      Returns:
      true if all data was written successfully; false for partial writes.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the client channel.

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection(SelectionKey key)
      Closes a client connection and removes associated resources.

      This method is called when a client disconnects or when an error occurs during I/O operations. It ensures the connection is closed gracefully, the client's data is removed from the clientDataMap, and the SelectionKey is canceled to prevent further events.

      Workflow:

      • Retrieves the client's SocketChannel from the selection key.
      • Removes the client from the clientDataMap.
      • Cancels the client's SelectionKey.
      • Closes the client's socket channel.

      Errors during the close operation are logged but do not interrupt the server's workflow.

      Parameters:
      key - the SelectionKey associated with the client connection.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the server and releases all associated resources.

      This method performs a graceful shutdown of the server, ensuring all active connections are closed, thread pools are terminated, and server resources like the Selector and ServerSocketChannel are released.

      Workflow:

      • Sets the isRunning flag to false to terminate the server loop.
      • Closes the ServerSocketChannel and Selector.
      • Iterates through all connected clients and safely closes their channels.
      • Shuts down the read and write thread pools.

      Errors during the shutdown process are logged but do not halt the shutdown sequence.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable

    • safeCloseClient

      private void safeCloseClient(SocketChannel client)
      Safely closes a single client connection.

      This method attempts to close the client's SocketChannel and logs any errors that occur during the operation. It ensures that resources are released without disrupting other shutdown processes.

      Parameters:
      client - the SocketChannel representing the client connection.
